Article.ArticleTitle: Investigation of catalytic activity of metal doped nanocages (Ni-C<sub>72</sub> and Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub>) for ozone decomposition to oxygen molecules.

AbstractText: The potential of Ni-C<sub>72</sub> and Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub> as effective catalysts for O<sub>3</sub> decomposition is examined by LH and ER mechanisms. The activation barrier energy and Gibbs free energy of reaction steps for O<sub>3</sub> decomposition on Ni-C<sub>72</sub> and Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub> are calculated. The ∆E<sub>formation</sub> of Ni-C<sub>72</sub> and Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub> are negative values and these structures are stable nano-catalysts. The Ni atoms are catalytic positions to adsorb the O<sub>3</sub> and other important species of O<sub>3</sub> decomposition by LH and ER mechanisms. The Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub> for O<sub>3</sub> decomposition has lower E<sub>acivation</sub> and more negative ∆G<sub>reaction</sub> than Ni-C<sub>72</sub>. The E<sub>acivation</sub> value of rate-determining step for O<sub>3</sub> decomposition by LH mechanism is lower than ER mechanism. The Ni-C<sub>72</sub> and Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub> can catalyze the reaction steps of O<sub>3</sub> decomposition by LH and ER mechanisms.

The structures of Ni-C<sub>72</sub> and Ni-Al<sub>36</sub>P<sub>36</sub> nanocages and their complexes with O<sub>3</sub> and other important species of are optimized by PW91PW91/6-311 + G (2d, 2p) model and M06-2X/cc-pVQZ model in GAMESS software. The strcutures of nanocages and their complexes with important species of O<sub>3</sub> decomposition by LH and ER mechanisms are optimized and their frequencies are calculated in order to demonstrate that these structures are real minima on the potential energy surface.
